   20: -module(code_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   23: -include_lib("syntax_tools/include/merl.hrl").
   24: 
   25: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2]).
   26: -export([set_path/1, get_path/1, add_path/1, add_paths/1, del_path/1,
   27: 	 replace_path/1, load_file/1, load_abs/1,
   28:      ensure_loaded/1, ensure_loaded_many/1, ensure_loaded_many_kill/1,
   29: 	 delete/1, purge/1, purge_many_exits/0, purge_many_exits/1,
   30:          soft_purge/1, is_loaded/1, all_loaded/1, all_available/1,
   31: 	 load_binary/1, dir_req/1, object_code/1, set_path_file/1,
   32: 	 upgrade/0, upgrade/1,
   33: 	 sticky_dir/1, pa_pz_option/1, add_del_path/1,
   34: 	 dir_disappeared/1, ext_mod_dep/1, clash/1,
   35: 	 where_is_file/1,
   36: 	 purge_stacktrace/1, mult_lib_roots/1, bad_erl_libs/1,
   37: 	 code_archive/1, code_archive2/1, on_load/1, on_load_binary/1,
   38: 	 on_load_embedded/1, on_load_errors/1, on_load_update/1,
   39:          on_load_trace_on_load/1,
   40: 	 on_load_purge/1, on_load_self_call/1, on_load_pending/1,
   41: 	 on_load_deleted/1,
   42: 	 big_boot_embedded/1,
   43:          module_status/1,
   44: 	 get_mode/1, code_path_cache/1,
   45: 	 normalized_paths/1, mult_embedded_flags/1]).
   46: 
   47: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   48: 	 init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1]).
   49: 
   50: %% error_logger
   51: -export([init/1,
   52: 	 handle_event/2, handle_call/2, handle_info/2,
   53: 	 terminate/2]).
   54: 
   55: -export([compile_load/4]).
   56: 
   57: suite() ->
   58:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   59:      {timetrap,{seconds,30}}].
   60: 
   61: all() ->
   62:     [set_path, get_path, add_path, add_paths, del_path,
   63:      replace_path, load_file, load_abs,
   64:      ensure_loaded, ensure_loaded_many, ensure_loaded_many_kill,
   65:      delete, purge, purge_many_exits, soft_purge, is_loaded, all_loaded,
   66:      all_available, load_binary, dir_req, object_code, set_path_file,
   67:      upgrade, code_path_cache,
   68:      sticky_dir, pa_pz_option, add_del_path, dir_disappeared,
   69:      ext_mod_dep, clash, where_is_file,
   70:      purge_stacktrace, mult_lib_roots,
   71:      bad_erl_libs, code_archive, code_archive2, on_load,
   72:      on_load_binary, on_load_embedded, on_load_errors,
   73:      {group, sequence},
   74:      on_load_purge, on_load_self_call, on_load_pending,
   75:      on_load_deleted,
   76:      module_status,
   77:      big_boot_embedded, get_mode, normalized_paths,
   78:      mult_embedded_flags].
   79: 
   80: %% These need to run in order
   81: groups() -> [{sequence, [sequence], [on_load_update,
   82:                                      on_load_trace_on_load]}].
   83: 
   84: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   85: 	Config.
   86: 
   87: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   88: 	Config.
   89: 
   90: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   91:     %% The compiler will no longer create a Beam file if
   92:     %% the module name does not match the filename, so
   93:     %% we must compile to a binary and write the Beam file
   94:     %% ourselves.
   95:     Dir = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
   96:     File = filename:join(Dir, "code_a_test"),
   97:     {ok,code_b_test,Code} = compile:file(File, [binary]),
   98:     ok = file:write_file(File++".beam", Code),
   99:     Config.
  100: 
  101: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  102:     Config.
  103: 
  104: -define(TESTMOD, test_dummy).
  105: -define(TESTMODSTR, "test_dummy").
  106: -define(TESTMODSRC, ?TESTMODSTR ".erl").
  107: -define(TESTMODOBJ, ?TESTMODSTR ".beam").
  108: 
  109: init_per_testcase(big_boot_embedded, Config) ->
  110:     case catch crypto:start() of
  111: 	ok ->
  112: 	    init_per_testcase(do_big_boot_embedded, Config);
  113: 	_Else ->
  114: 	    {skip, "Needs crypto!"}
  115:     end;
  116: init_per_testcase(on_load_embedded, Config0) ->
  117:     LibRoot = code:lib_dir(),
  118:     LinkName = filename:join(LibRoot, "on_load_app-1.0"),
  119:     Config = [{link_name,LinkName}|Config0],
  120:     init_per_testcase(Config);
  121: init_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
  122:     init_per_testcase(Config).
  123: 
  124: init_per_testcase(Config) ->
  125:     P = code:get_path(),
  126:     [{code_path, P}|Config].
  127: 
  128: 
  129: end_per_testcase(module_status, Config) ->
  130:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
  131:     code:delete(?TESTMOD),
  132:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
  133:     file:delete(?TESTMODOBJ),
  134:     file:delete(?TESTMODSRC),
  135:     end_per_testcase(Config);
  136: end_per_testcase(TC, Config) when TC == mult_lib_roots;
  137: 				  TC == big_boot_embedded ->
  138:     {ok, HostName} = inet:gethostname(),
  139:     NodeName = list_to_atom(atom_to_list(TC)++"@"++HostName),
  140:     test_server:stop_node(NodeName),
  141:     end_per_testcase(Config);
  142: end_per_testcase(on_load_embedded, Config) ->
  143:     LinkName = proplists:get_value(link_name, Config),
  144:     _ = del_link(LinkName),
  145:     end_per_testcase(Config);
  146: end_per_testcase(upgrade, Config) ->
  147:     %% Make sure tracing is turned off even if the test times out.
  148:     erlang:trace_pattern({error_handler,undefined_function,3}, false, [global]),
  149:     erlang:trace(self(), false, [call]),
  150:     end_per_testcase(Config);
  151: end_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
  152:     end_per_testcase(Config).
  153: 
  154: end_per_testcase(Config) ->
  155:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  156:     P=proplists:get_value(code_path, Config),
  157:     true=code:set_path(P),
  158:     P=code:get_path(),
  159:     ok.
  160: 
  161: set_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  162:     P = code:get_path(),
  163:     NonExDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), test_server:temp_name("hej")),
  164:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:set_path({a})),
  165:     {error, bad_directory} = (catch code:set_path([{a}])),
  166:     {error, bad_directory} = code:set_path(NonExDir),
  167:     P = code:get_path(), % still the same path.
  168:     true = code:set_path(P), % set the same path again.
  169:     P = code:get_path(), % still the same path.
  170:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  171:     true = code:set_path([LibDir | P]),
  172:     [LibDir | P] = code:get_path(),
  173:     true = code:set_path([LibDir]),
  174:     [LibDir] = code:get_path(),
  175:     ok.
  176: 
  177: get_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  178:     P = code:get_path(),
  179:     %% test that all directories are strings (lists).
  180:     [] = lists:filter(fun
  181: 	    (Dir) when is_list(Dir) -> false;
  182: 	    (_) -> true
  183: 	end, P),
  184:     ok.
  185: 
  186: add_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  187:     P = code:get_path(),
  188:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:add_path({})),
  189:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:add_patha({})),
  190:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:add_pathz({})),
  191:     {error, bad_directory} = code:add_path("xyz"),
  192:     {error, bad_directory} = code:add_patha("xyz"),
  193:     {error, bad_directory} = code:add_pathz("xyz"),
  194:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  195:     true = code:add_path(LibDir),
  196:     LibDir = lists:last(code:get_path()),
  197:     code:set_path(P),
  198:     true = code:add_pathz(LibDir),
  199:     LibDir = lists:last(code:get_path()),
  200:     code:set_path(P),
  201:     true = code:add_patha(LibDir),
  202:     [LibDir|_] = code:get_path(),
  203:     code:set_path(P),
  204:     ok.
  205: 
  206: add_paths(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  207:     P = code:get_path(),
  208:     ok = code:add_paths([{}]),
  209:     ok = code:add_pathsa([{}]),
  210:     ok = code:add_pathsz([{}]),
  211:     ok = code:add_paths(["xyz"]),
  212:     ok = code:add_pathsa(["xyz"]),
  213:     ok = code:add_pathsz(["xyz"]),
  214:     P = code:get_path(), % check that no directory is added.
  215: 
  216:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  217:     ok = code:add_paths([LibDir]),
  218:     LibDir = lists:last(code:get_path()),
  219:     code:set_path(P),
  220:     ok = code:add_pathsz([LibDir]),
  221:     LibDir = lists:last(code:get_path()),
  222:     code:set_path(P),
  223:     ok = code:add_pathsa([LibDir]),
  224:     [LibDir|P] = code:get_path(),
  225:     code:set_path(P),
  226: 
  227:     RootDir = code:root_dir(),
  228:     Res = P ++ [LibDir, RootDir],
  229:     ok = code:add_paths([LibDir, RootDir]),
  230:     Res = code:get_path(),
  231:     code:set_path(P),
  232:     ok = code:add_pathsz([LibDir, RootDir]),
  233:     Res = code:get_path(),
  234:     code:set_path(P),
  235:     ok = code:add_pathsa([LibDir, RootDir]),
  236:     [RootDir, LibDir|P] = code:get_path(),
  237:     code:set_path(P),
  238: 
  239:     ok = code:add_paths([LibDir, "xyz"]),
  240:     Res1 = P ++ [LibDir],
  241:     Res1 = code:get_path(),
  242:     code:set_path(P),
  243:     ok = code:add_pathsz([LibDir, "xyz"]),
  244:     Res1 = code:get_path(),
  245:     code:set_path(P),
  246:     ok = code:add_pathsa([LibDir, "xyz"]),
  247:     [LibDir|P] = code:get_path(),
  248:     code:set_path(P),
  249:     ok.
  250: 
  251: del_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  252:     P = code:get_path(),
  253:     try
  254: 	del_path_1(P)
  255:     after
  256: 	code:set_path(P)
  257:     end.
  258: 
  259: del_path_1(P) ->
  260:     io:format("Initial code:get_path()=~p~n",[P]),
  261:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:del_path(3)),
  262:     false = code:del_path(my_dummy_name),
  263:     false = code:del_path("/kdlk/my_dummy_dir"),
  264:     Dir = filename:join([code:lib_dir(kernel),"ebin"]),
  265:     io:format("kernel dir: ~p~n",[Dir]),
  266: 
  267:     true = code:del_path(kernel),
  268:     NewP = code:get_path(),
  269:     io:format("Path after removing 'kernel':~p~n",[NewP]),
  270:     ReferenceP = lists:delete(Dir,P),
  271:     io:format("Reference path:~p~n",[ReferenceP]),
  272:     NewP = ReferenceP, % check that dir is deleted
  273:     code:set_path(P),
  274: 
  275:     %% An superfluous "/" should also work.
  276:     true = code:del_path("kernel/"),
  277:     NewP = ReferenceP,			   % check that dir is deleted
  278:     code:set_path(P),
  279: 
  280:     true = code:del_path(Dir),
  281:     NewP1 = code:get_path(),
  282:     NewP1 = lists:delete(Dir,P), % check that dir is deleted
  283:     ok.
  284: 
  285: replace_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  286:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  287:     P = code:get_path(),
  288:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:replace_path(3,"")),
  289:     {error, bad_name} = code:replace_path(dummy_name,""),
  290:     {error, bad_name} = code:replace_path(kernel,
  291: 						"/kdlk/my_dummy_dir"),
  292:     {error, bad_directory} = code:replace_path(kernel,
  293: 						     "/kdlk/kernel-1.2"),
  294:     P = code:get_path(), % Check that path is not changed.
  295: 
  296:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  297: 
  298:     %% Replace an existing application.
  299: 
  300:     file:make_dir("./kernel-2.11"),
  301:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
  302:     NewDir = Cwd ++ "/kernel-2.11",
  303:     true = code:replace_path(kernel, NewDir),
  304:     NewDir = code:lib_dir(kernel),
  305:     true = code:set_path(P),			%Reset path
  306:     ok = file:del_dir("./kernel-2.11"),
  307: 
  308:     %% Add a completely new application.
  309: 
  310:     NewAppName = 'blurf_blarfer',
  311:     NewAppDir = filename:join(Cwd, atom_to_list(NewAppName) ++ "-6.33.1"),
  312:     ok = file:make_dir(NewAppDir),
  313:     true = code:replace_path(NewAppName, NewAppDir),
  314:     NewAppDir = code:lib_dir(NewAppName),
  315:     NewAppDir = lists:last(code:get_path()),
  316:     true = code:set_path(P),			%Reset path
  317:     ok = file:del_dir(NewAppDir),
  318: 
  319:     ok.
  320: 
  321: code_path_cache(Config) ->
  322:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  323: 
  324:     non_existing = code:which(?TESTMOD), % verify dummy name not in path
  325:     code:purge(?TESTMOD), % ensure no previous version in memory
  326:     code:delete(?TESTMOD),
  327:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
  328: 
  329:     Original = code:get_path(),
  330:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "myebin"),
  331:     filelib:ensure_path(Dir),
  332:     ToBeReplacedDir1 = filename:join(PrivDir, "tobereplaced-1/ebin"),
  333:     ToBeReplacedDir2 = filename:join(PrivDir, "tobereplaced-2/ebin"),
  334:     filelib:ensure_path(ToBeReplacedDir1),
  335:     filelib:ensure_path(ToBeReplacedDir2),
  336: 
  337:     File = filename:join(Dir, ?TESTMODOBJ),
  338:     {ok,?TESTMOD,Bin} = compile:forms(dummy_ast(), []),
  339: 
  340:     %% Adding a cached path and re-adding for clearing
  341:     [begin
  342:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  343:         true = code:Fun(Dir, cache),
  344:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  345:         ok = file:write_file(File, Bin),
  346:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  347:         true = code:Fun(Dir, cache),
  348:         {_,_,_} = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  349:         code:del_path(Dir),
  350:         ok = file:delete(File)
  351:      end || Fun <- [add_path, add_patha, add_pathz]],
  352: 
  353:     Original = code:get_path(),
  354: 
  355:     %% Adding several cached paths and explicit cache clearing
  356:     [begin
  357:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  358:         ok = code:Fun([Dir, ToBeReplacedDir1], cache),
  359:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  360:         ok = file:write_file(File, Bin),
  361:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  362:         ok = code:clear_cache(),
  363:         {_,_,_} = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  364:         ok = code:del_paths([Dir, ToBeReplacedDir1]),
  365:         ok = file:delete(File)
  366:      end || Fun <- [add_paths, add_pathsa, add_pathsz]],
  367: 
  368:     Original = code:get_path(),
  369: 
  370:     %% Replacing a non-cached path with cache and set_path for clearing
  371:     error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  372:     true = code:add_path(ToBeReplacedDir1),
  373:     true = code:replace_path(tobereplaced, ToBeReplacedDir2, cache),
  374:     error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  375:     ok = file:write_file(filename:join(ToBeReplacedDir2, ?TESTMODOBJ), Bin),
  376:     error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  377:     true = code:set_path(code:get_path(), nocache),
  378:     {_,_,_} = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  379: 
  380:     true = code:set_path(Original),
  381:     ok.
  382: 
  383: %% OTP-3977.
  384: dir_disappeared(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  385:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  386:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "temp"),
  387:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  388:     true = code:add_path(Dir),
  389:     ok = file:del_dir(Dir),
  390:     non_existing = code:which(bubbelskrammel),
  391:     ok.
  392: 
  393: load_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  394:     {error, nofile} = code:load_file(duuuumy_mod),
  395:     {error, badfile} = code:load_file(code_a_test),
  396:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch code:load_file(123)),
  397:     {module, code_b_test} = code:load_file(code_b_test),
  398:     TestDir = test_dir(),
  399:     code:stick_dir(TestDir),
  400:     {error, sticky_directory} = code:load_file(code_b_test),
  401:     code:unstick_dir(TestDir),
  402:     ok.
  403: 
  404: test_dir() ->
  405:     filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)).
  406: 
  407: load_abs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  408:     TestDir = test_dir(),
  409:     {error, nofile} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/duuuumy_mod"),
  410:     {error, badfile} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/code_a_test"),
  411:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch code:load_abs({})),
  412:     {error, nofile} = code:load_abs("Non-latin-имя-файла"),
  413:     {module, code_b_test} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/code_b_test"),
  414:     code:stick_dir(TestDir),
  415:     {error, sticky_directory} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/code_b_test"),
  416:     code:unstick_dir(TestDir),
  417:     ok.
  418: 
  419: ensure_loaded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  420:     {module, lists} = code:ensure_loaded(lists),
  421:     case init:get_argument(mode) of
  422: 	{ok, [["embedded"] | _]} ->
  423: 	    {error, embedded} = code:ensure_loaded(code_b_test),
  424: 	    {error, badarg} = code:ensure_loaded(34),
  425: 	    ok;
  426: 	_ ->
  427: 	    {error, nofile} = code:ensure_loaded(duuuumy_mod),
  428: 	    {error, badfile} = code:ensure_loaded(code_a_test),
  429: 	    {'EXIT', _} = (catch code:ensure_loaded(34)),
  430: 	    {module, code_b_test} = code:ensure_loaded(code_b_test),
  431: 	    {module, code_b_test} = code:ensure_loaded(code_b_test),
  432: 	    ok
  433:     end.
  434: 
  435: ensure_loaded_many(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  436:     with_large_loadpath_peer(Config, fun(Node) ->
  437:         %% Without special handling for async loading in code server,
  438:         %% this operation seemed to consistently take 5s+
  439:         Action = fun() ->
  440:             Self = self(),
  441:             Fun = fun() -> code:ensure_loaded(code_b_test), Self ! {done, self()} end,
  442:             Pids = [spawn(Fun) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 1_000)],
  443:             [receive {done, Pid} -> ok end || Pid <- Pids],
  444:             ok
  445:         end,
  446:         ok = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply, [Action, []], 1_000)
  447:     end).
  448: 
  449: ensure_loaded_many_kill(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  450:     with_large_loadpath_peer(Config, fun(Node) ->
  451:         Action = fun() ->
  452:             Self = self(),
  453:             Fun = fun() -> code:ensure_loaded(code_b_test), Self ! {done, self()} end,
  454:             sys:suspend(code_server),
  455:             First = spawn_opt(Fun, [{priority, max}]),
  456:             Pids = [spawn(Fun) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 1_000)],
  457:             sys:resume(code_server),
  458:             exit(First, kill),
  459:             [receive {done, Pid} -> ok end || Pid <- Pids],
  460:             {file, _} = code:is_loaded(code_b_test),
  461:             ok
  462:         end,
  463:         ok = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply, [Action, []])
  464:     end).
  465: 
  466: with_large_loadpath_peer(Config, Fun) ->
  467:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  468:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  469:     ok = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply, [fun set_up_large_loadpath/1, [Priv]]),
  470:     try Fun(Node)
  471:     after peer:stop(Peer)
  472:     end.
  473: 
  474: set_up_large_loadpath(Priv) ->
  475:     false = code:delete(code_b_test),
  476:     Dirs = [filename:join(Priv, integer_to_list(N)) || N <- lists:seq(1, 500)],
  477:     [ok = filelib:ensure_path(Dir) || Dir <- Dirs],
  478:     [true = code:add_patha(Dir) || Dir <- Dirs],
  479:     ok.
  480: 
  481: delete(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  482:     OldFlag = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  483:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  484:     Pid = code_b_test:do_spawn(),
  485:     true = code:delete(code_b_test),
  486:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:delete(122)),
  487:     false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  488:     false = code:delete(code_b_test),
  489:     false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  490:     exit(Pid,kill),
  491:     true = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  492:     false = code:delete(code_b_test),
  493:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  494:     process_flag(trap_exit, OldFlag),
  495:     ok.
  496: 
  497: purge(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  498:     run_purge_test(fun purge_test/1, Config).
  499: 
  500: purge_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  501:     OldFlag = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  502:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  503:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:purge({})),
  504:     false = code:purge(code_b_test),
  505:     Pid = code_b_test:do_spawn(),
  506:     true = code:delete(code_b_test),
  507:     false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  508:     true = code:purge(code_b_test),
  509:     true = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  510:     process_flag(trap_exit, OldFlag),
  511:     ok.
  512: 
  513: purge_many_exits() ->
  514:     [{timetrap, {minutes, 2}}].
  515: 
  516: purge_many_exits(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  517:     run_purge_test(fun purge_many_exits_test/1, Config).
  518: 
  519: purge_many_exits_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  520:     OldFlag = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  521: 
  522:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  523:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:purge({})),
  524: 
  525:     CodePurgeF = fun(M, Exp) -> Exp = code:purge(M) end,
  526:     purge_many_exits_do(CodePurgeF),
  527: 
  528:     %% Let's repeat test for erlang:purge_module as it does the same thing
  529:     %% now in erts-8.0 (except for return value).
  530:     ErlangPurgeF = fun(M, _Exp) -> erlang:purge_module(M) end,
  531:     purge_many_exits_do(ErlangPurgeF),
  532: 
  533:     process_flag(trap_exit, OldFlag),
  534:     ok.
  535: 
  536: 
  537: purge_many_exits_do(PurgeF) ->
  538:     false = code:purge(code_b_test),
  539:     TPids = lists:map(fun (_) ->
  540: 			      {code_b_test:do_spawn(),
  541: 			       spawn_link(fun () ->
  542: 						  receive
  543: 						  after infinity -> ok
  544: 						  end
  545: 					  end)}
  546: 			 end,
  547: 			 lists:seq(1, 1000)),
  548:     %% Give them time to start...
  549:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  550:     true = code:delete(code_b_test),
  551:     lists:foreach(fun ({Pid1, Pid2}) ->
  552: 			  true = erlang:is_process_alive(Pid1),
  553: 			  false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid1),
  554: 			  true = erlang:is_process_alive(Pid2)
  555: 		  end, TPids),
  556:     PurgeF(code_b_test, true),
  557:     lists:foreach(fun ({Pid1, Pid2}) ->
  558: 			  false = erlang:is_process_alive(Pid1),
  559: 			  true = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid1),
  560: 			  true = erlang:is_process_alive(Pid2),
  561: 			  exit(Pid2, kill)
  562: 		  end, TPids),
  563:     lists:foreach(fun ({_Pid1, Pid2}) ->
  564: 			  receive {'EXIT', Pid2, _} -> ok end
  565: 		  end, TPids).
  566: 
  567: 
  568: soft_purge(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  569:     run_purge_test(fun soft_purge_test/1, Config).
  570: 
  571: soft_purge_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  572:     OldFlag = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  573:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  574:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:soft_purge(23)),
  575:     true = code:soft_purge(code_b_test),
  576:     Pid = code_b_test:do_spawn(),
  577:     true = code:delete(code_b_test),
  578:     false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  579:     false = code:soft_purge(code_b_test),
  580:     false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  581:     exit(Pid,kill),
  582:     true = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  583:     true = code:soft_purge(code_b_test),
  584:     process_flag(trap_exit, OldFlag),
  585:     ok.
  586: 
  587: is_loaded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  588:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  589:     code:delete(code_b_test),
  590:     false = code:is_loaded(duuuuuumy_mod),
  591:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:is_loaded(23)),
  592:     {file, preloaded} = code:is_loaded(init),
  593:     TestDir = test_dir(),
  594:     {module, code_b_test} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/code_b_test"),
  595:     {file, _Loaded} = code:is_loaded(code_b_test),
  596:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  597:     code:delete(code_b_test),
  598:     ok.
  599: 
  600: all_loaded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  601:     case test_server:is_cover() of
  602: 	true -> {skip,"Cover is running"};
  603: 	false -> all_loaded_1()
  604:     end.
  605: 
  606: all_loaded_1() ->
  607:     Preloaded = [{M,preloaded} || M <- lists:sort(erlang:pre_loaded())],
  608: 
  609:     Loaded0 = lists:sort(code:all_loaded()),
  610:     all_unique(Loaded0),
  611:     Loaded1 = lists:keysort(2, Loaded0),
  612:     Loaded2 = match_and_remove(Preloaded, Loaded1),
  613: 
  614:     ObjExt = code:objfile_extension(),
  615:     [] = lists:filter(fun
  616: 	    ({Mod,AbsName}) when is_atom(Mod), is_list(AbsName) ->
  617: 		Mod =/= list_to_atom(filename:basename(AbsName, ObjExt));
  618: 	    (_) -> true
  619: 	end, Loaded2),
  620:     ok.
  621: 
  622: match_and_remove([], List) -> List;
  623: match_and_remove([X|T1], [X|T2]) -> match_and_remove(T1, T2).
  624: 
  625: all_unique([]) -> ok;
  626: all_unique([_]) -> ok;
  627: all_unique([{X,_}|[{Y,_}|_]=T]) when X < Y -> all_unique(T).
  628: 
  629: all_available(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  630:     case test_server:is_cover() of
  631: 	true -> {skip,"Cover is running"};
  632: 	false -> all_available_1(Config)
  633:     end.
  634: 
  635: all_available_1(Config) ->
  636: 
  637:     %% Add an ez dir to make sure the modules in there are found
  638:     DDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config)++"clash/",
  639:     true = code:add_path(DDir++"foobar-0.1.ez/foobar-0.1/ebin"),
  640: 
  641:     Available = code:all_available(),
  642: 
  643:     %% Test that baz and blarg that are part of the .ez archive are found
  644:     {value, _} =
  645:         lists:search(fun({Name,_,Loaded}) -> not Loaded andalso Name =:= "baz" end, Available),
  646:     {value, _} =
  647:         lists:search(fun({Name,_,Loaded}) -> not Loaded andalso Name =:= "blarg" end, Available),
  648: 
  649:     %% Test that all loaded are part of all available
  650:     Loaded = [{atom_to_list(M),P,true} || {M,P} <- code:all_loaded()],
  651:     [] = Loaded -- Available,
  652: 
  653:     {value, {ModStr,_,false} = NotLoaded} =
  654:         lists:search(fun({Name,_,Loaded}) -> not is_atom(Name) end, Available),
  655:     ct:log("Testing with ~p",[NotLoaded]),
  656: 
  657:     Mod = list_to_atom(ModStr),
  658: 
  659:     %% Test that the module is actually not loaded
  660:     false = code:is_loaded(Mod),
  661: 
  662:     %% Load it
  663:     Mod:module_info(),
  664: 
  665:     {value, {ModStr,_,true}} =
  666:         lists:search(fun({Name,_,_}) -> Name =:= ModStr end, code:all_available()),
  667: 
  668:     ok.
  669: 
  670: load_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  671:     TestDir = test_dir(),
  672:     File = TestDir ++ "/code_b_test" ++ code:objfile_extension(),
  673:     {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(File),
  674:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:load_binary(12, File, Bin)),
  675:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:load_binary(code_b_test, 12, Bin)),
  676:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:load_binary(code_b_test, File, 12)),
  677:     {module, code_b_test} = code:load_binary(code_b_test, File, Bin),
  678:     code:stick_dir(TestDir),
  679:     {error, sticky_directory} = code:load_binary(code_b_test, File, Bin),
  680:     code:unstick_dir(TestDir),
  681:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  682:     code:delete(code_b_test),
  683:     ok.
  684: 
  685: 
  686: upgrade() ->
  687:     [{timetrap,{minutes,2}}].
  688: 
  689: upgrade(Config) ->
  690:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  691:     upgrade_do(DataDir, beam, [beam]),
  692:     ok.
  693: 
  694: upgrade_do(DataDir, Client, T) ->
  695:     compile_load(upgrade_client, DataDir, undefined, Client),
  696:     [upgrade_client:run(DataDir, U1, U2, O1, O2)
  697:      || U1<-T, U2<-T, O1<-T, O2<-T],
  698:     ok.
  699: 
  700: compile_load(Mod, Dir, Ver, CodeType) ->
  701:     %%erlang:display({"{{{{{{{{{{{{{{{{Loading",Mod,Ver,CodeType}),
  702:     Version = case Ver of
  703: 	undefined ->
  704: 	    io:format("Compiling '~p' as ~p\n", [Mod, CodeType]),
  705: 	    [];
  706: 	_ ->
  707: 	    io:format("Compiling version ~p of '~p' as ~p\n",
  708: 		[Ver, Mod, CodeType]),
  709: 	    [{d,list_to_atom("VERSION_" ++ integer_to_list(Ver))}]
  710:     end,
  711: 
  712:     CompOpts = [binary, report] ++ Version,
  713: 
  714:     Src = filename:join(Dir, atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".erl"),
  715:     T1 = erlang:now(),
  716:     {ok,Mod,Code} = compile:file(Src, CompOpts),
  717:     T2 = erlang:now(),
  718:     ObjFile = filename:basename(Src,".erl") ++ ".beam",
  719:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, ObjFile, Code),
  720:     T3 = erlang:now(),
  721:     io:format("Compile time ~p ms, Load time ~p ms\n",
  722: 	      [timer:now_diff(T2,T1) div 1000, timer:now_diff(T3,T2) div 1000]),
  723:     %%erlang:display({"}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}Loaded",Mod,Ver,CodeType}),
  724:     ok.
  725: 
  726: dir_req(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  727:     {ok,[[Root0]]} = init:get_argument(root),
  728:     Root = filename:join([Root0]),	% Normalised form.
  729:     Root = code:root_dir(),
  730:     LibDir = Root ++ "/lib",
  731:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  732:     code:compiler_dir(),
  733:     {error, bad_name} = code:lib_dir(duuumy),
  734:     KernLib = code:lib_dir(kernel),
  735:     Priv = KernLib ++ "/priv",
  736:     Priv = code:priv_dir(kernel),
  737:     {error, bad_name} = code:priv_dir(duuumy),
  738:     ok.
  739: 
  740: object_code(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  741:     TestDir = test_dir(),
  742:     P = code:get_path(),
  743:     P = code:get_path(),
  744:     code:add_path(TestDir),
  745:     {module, code_b_test} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/code_b_test"),
  746:     LoadedFile = filename:absname(TestDir ++ "/code_b_test" ++
  747: 				  code:objfile_extension()),
  748:     case code:get_object_code(code_b_test) of
  749: 	      {code_b_test,Bin,LoadedFile} when is_binary(Bin) ->
  750: 		  ok
  751: 	  end,
  752:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  753:     code:delete(code_b_test),
  754:     error = code:get_object_code(dddddddduuuuuuumy),
  755:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:get_object_code(23)),
  756:     code:set_path(P),
  757:     P=code:get_path(),
  758:     ok.
  759: 
  760: %% Test that set_path does not accept
  761: %% files as pathnames (known previous bug)
  762: set_path_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  763:     File=filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), "testfil"),
  764:     ok=file:write_file(File, list_to_binary("lite data")),
  765:     {error, bad_directory}=code:set_path([File]).
  766: 
  767: %% Test that a module with the same name as a module in
  768: %% a sticky directory cannot be loaded.
  769: sticky_dir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  770:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  771:     Mods = [code,lists,erlang,init],
  772:     OutDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), sticky_dir),
  773:     _ = file:make_dir(OutDir),
  774:     Ret = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply,
  775: 		   [fun sticky_compiler/2,[Mods,OutDir]]),
  776:     case Ret of
  777: 	[] ->
  778: 	    ok;
  779: 	Other ->
  780: 	    io:format("~p\n", [Other]),
  781: 	    ct:fail(failed)
  782:     end,
  783:     peer:stop(Peer),
  784:     ok.
  785: 
  786: sticky_compiler(Files, PrivDir) ->
  787:     code:add_patha(PrivDir),
  788:     Rets = [do_sticky_compile(F, PrivDir) || F <- Files],
  789:     [R || R <- Rets, R =/= ok].
  790: 
  791: do_sticky_compile(Mod, Dir) ->
  792:     case code:is_sticky(Mod) of
  793:         true ->
  794:             %% Make sure that the module is loaded. A module being sticky
  795:             %% only prevents it from begin reloaded, not from being loaded
  796:             %% from the wrong place to begin with.
  797:             Mod = Mod:module_info(module),
  798:             File = filename:append(Dir, atom_to_list(Mod)),
  799:             Src = io_lib:format("-module(~s).\n"
  800:                                 "-export([test/1]).\n"
  801:                                 "test(me) -> fail.\n", [Mod]),
  802:             ok = file:write_file(File++".erl", Src),
  803:             case c:c(File, [{outdir,Dir}]) of
  804:                 {ok,Module} ->
  805:                     Module:test(me);
  806:                 {error,sticky_directory} ->
  807:                     ok
  808:             end;
  809:         false ->
  810:             %% For some reason the module is not sticky
  811:             %% could be that the .erlang file has
  812:             %% unstuck it?
  813:             {Mod, is_not_sticky}
  814:     end.
  815: 
  816: %% Test that the -pa and -pz options work as expected.
  817: pa_pz_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  818:     DDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),
  819:     PaDir = filename:join(DDir,"pa"),
  820:     PzDir = filename:join(DDir,"pz"),
  821:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-pa", PaDir, "-pz", PzDir]),
  822:     Ret=rpc:call(Node, code, get_path, []),
  823:     [PaDir|Paths] = Ret,
  824:     [PzDir|_] = lists:reverse(Paths),
  825:     peer:stop(Peer),
  826:     {ok, Peer2, Node2} = ?CT_PEER(["-mode", "embedded", "-pa",
  827:         PaDir, "-pz", PzDir]),
  828:     Ret2=rpc:call(Node2, code, get_path, []),
  829:     [PaDir|Paths2] = Ret2,
  830:     [PzDir|_] = lists:reverse(Paths2),
  831:     peer:stop(Peer2).
  832: 
  833: %% add_path, del_path should not cause priv_dir(App) to fail.
  834: add_del_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  835:     DDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),
  836:     Dir1 = filename:join(DDir,"dummy_app-1.0/ebin"),
  837:     Dir2 = filename:join(DDir,"dummy_app-2.0/ebin"),
  838:     code:add_patha(Dir1),
  839:     PrivDir1 = filename:join(DDir,"dummy_app-1.0/priv"),
  840:     PrivDir1 = code:priv_dir(dummy_app),
  841:     code:add_path(Dir2), % put last in path
  842:     PrivDir1 = code:priv_dir(dummy_app),
  843:     code:del_path(Dir2),
  844:     PrivDir1 = code:priv_dir(dummy_app),
  845:     ok.
  846: 
  847: 
  848: clash(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  849:     DDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config)++"clash/",
  850:     P = code:get_path(),
  851: 
  852:     %% test non-clashing entries
  853: 
  854:     true = code:add_path(DDir++"foobar-0.1/ebin"),
  855:     true = code:add_path(DDir++"zork-0.8/ebin"),
  856:     ct:capture_start(),
  857:     ok = code:clash(),
  858:     ct:capture_stop(),
  859:     [OKMsg|_] = ct:capture_get(),
  860:     true = lists:prefix("** Found 0 name clashes", OKMsg),
  861:     true = code:set_path(P),
  862: 
  863:     %% test clashing entries
  864: 
  865:     true = code:add_path(DDir++"foobar-0.1/ebin"),
  866:     true = code:add_path(DDir++"foobar-0.1.ez/foobar-0.1/ebin"),
  867:     ct:capture_start(),
  868:     ok = code:clash(),
  869:     ct:capture_stop(),
  870:     [ClashMsg|_] = ct:capture_get(),
  871:     {match, [" hides "]} = re:run(ClashMsg, "\\*\\* .*( hides ).*",
  872: 					[{capture,all_but_first,list}]),
  873:     true = code:set_path(P),
  874: 
  875:     %% test "Bad path can't read"
  876: 
  877:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  878:     TmpEzFile = Priv++"foobar-0.tmp.ez",
  879:     {ok, _} = file:copy(DDir++"foobar-0.1.ez", TmpEzFile),
  880:     true = code:add_path(TmpEzFile++"/foobar-0.1/ebin"),
  881:     case os:type() of
  882:         {win32,_} ->
  883: 	    %% The file won't be deleted on windows until it's closed, why we
  884: 	    %% need to rename instead.
  885: 	    ok = file:rename(TmpEzFile,TmpEzFile++".moved");
  886: 	 _ ->
  887:     	    ok = file:delete(TmpEzFile)
  888:     end,
  889:     ct:capture_start(),
  890:     ok = code:clash(),
  891:     ct:capture_stop(),
  892:     [BadPathMsg|_] = ct:capture_get(),
  893:     true = lists:prefix("** Bad path can't read", BadPathMsg),
  894:     true = code:set_path(P),
  895:     file:delete(TmpEzFile++".moved"), %% Only effect on windows
  896:     ok.
  897: 
  898: %% Every module that the code_server uses should be preloaded,
  899: %% this test case verifies that.
  900: ext_mod_dep(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  901:     xref:start(s),
  902:     xref:set_default(s, [{verbose,false},{warnings,false},
  903: 			 {builtins,true},{recurse,true}]),
  904:     xref:set_library_path(s, code:get_path()),
  905:     xref:add_directory(s, filename:join(code:lib_dir(kernel),"ebin")),
  906:     xref:add_directory(s, filename:join(code:lib_dir(stdlib),"ebin")),
  907:     case catch ext_mod_dep2() of
  908: 	{'EXIT', Reason} ->
  909: 	    xref:stop(s),
  910: 	    exit(Reason);
  911: 	Else ->
  912:     	    xref:stop(s),
  913: 	    case Else of
  914: 		ok -> ok;
  915: 		_ -> ct:fail(Else)
  916: 	    end
  917:     end.
  918: 
  919: ext_mod_dep2() ->
  920:     Exports0 = code_server:module_info(exports) --
  921: 	[{module_info,0},{module_info,1}],
  922:     Exports = [{code_server,M,A} || {M,A} <- Exports0],
  923:     case analyse(Exports, [], [], 0) of
  924: 	{_Visited,0} ->
  925: 	    ok;
  926: 	{_Visited,ErrCnt} ->
  927: 	    {not_verified,ErrCnt}
  928:     end.
  929: 
  930: analyse([], [], Visited, ErrCnt) ->
  931:     {Visited,ErrCnt};
  932: analyse([], [This={M,F,A}|Path], Visited, ErrCnt0) ->
  933:     %% The code_server has been granted to use the following modules,
  934:     %% These modules should be loaded by code.erl before
  935:     %% the code_server is started.
  936:     OK = [erlang, os, prim_file, erl_prim_loader, init, ets,
  937: 	  code_server, lists, lists_sort, unicode, binary, filename,
  938: 	  gb_sets, gb_trees, erts_code_purger, erts_internal, code,
  939: 	  prim_zip, zlib],
  940:     ErrCnt1 =
  941: 	case lists:member(M, OK) or erlang:is_builtin(M,F,A) of
  942: 	    true ->
  943: 		0;
  944: 	    false ->
  945: 		check_funs(This, Path)
  946: 	end,
  947:     {Visited, ErrCnt1+ErrCnt0};
  948: analyse([MFA|R], Path, Visited0, ErrCnt0) ->
  949:     case lists:member(MFA,Visited0) of
  950: 	false ->
  951: 	    {Visited,ErrCnt1} = analyse2(MFA, Path, Visited0),
  952: 	    analyse(R, Path, Visited, ErrCnt1+ErrCnt0);
  953: 	true ->
  954: 	    analyse(R, Path, Visited0, ErrCnt0)
  955:     end.
  956: 
  957: analyse2(MFA = {'$M_EXPR',_, _}, Path, Visited0) ->
  958:     analyse([], [MFA|Path], Visited0, 0);
  959: analyse2(MFA={_,_,_}, Path, Visited0) ->
  960:     {ok, FL} = xref:analyze(s,{call,MFA}),
  961:     analyse(FL, [MFA|Path], my_usort([MFA|Visited0]), 0).
  962: 
  963: %%%% We need to check these manually...
  964: %% fun's are ok as long as they are defined locally.
  965: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
  966: 	   [{unicode,characters_to_binary_int,3},
  967: 	    {unicode,characters_to_binary,3},
  968: 	    {filename,filename_string_to_binary,1}|_]) -> 0;
  969: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
  970: 	   [{unicode,ml_map,3},
  971: 	    {unicode,characters_to_binary_int,3},
  972: 	    {unicode,characters_to_binary,3},
  973: 	    {filename,filename_string_to_binary,1}|_]) -> 0;
  974: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
  975: 	   [{unicode,do_o_binary2,2},
  976: 	    {unicode,do_o_binary,2},
  977: 	    {unicode,o_trans,1},
  978: 	    {unicode,characters_to_binary_int,3},
  979: 	    {unicode,characters_to_binary,3},
  980: 	    {filename,filename_string_to_binary,1}|_]) -> 0;
  981: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
  982: 	   [{code_server,do_mod_call,4},
  983: 	    {code_server,handle_call,3}|_]) -> 0;
  984: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
  985: 	   [{lists,flatmap_1,2},
  986: 	    {lists,flatmap,2},
  987: 	    {lists,concat,1},
  988: 	    {code_server,load_abs,4},
  989: 	    {code_server,handle_call,3},
  990: 	    {code_server,loop,1}|_]) -> 0;
  991: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
  992: 	   [{lists,foreach_1,2},
  993: 	    {lists,foreach,2},
  994: 	    {code_server,stick_dir,3},
  995: 	    {code_server,handle_call,3},
  996: 	    {code_server,loop,1}|_]) -> 0;
  997: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',1},
  998: 	   [{lists,all,2},
  999: 	    {code_server,is_numstr,1},
 1000: 	    {code_server,is_vsn,1},
 1001: 	    {code_server,vsn_to_num,1},
 1002: 	    {code_server,create_bundle,2},
 1003: 	    {code_server,choose_bundles,1},
 1004: 	    {code_server,make_path,2},
 1005: 	    {code_server,get_user_lib_dirs_1,1},
 1006: 	    {code_server,get_user_lib_dirs,0},
 1007: 	    {code_server,init,3},
 1008: 	    {code_server,start_link,1}]) -> 0;
 1009: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',1},
 1010: 	   [{lists,all_1,2},
 1011: 	    {lists,all,2},
 1012: 	    {code_server,is_numstr,1},
 1013: 	    {code_server,is_vsn,1},
 1014: 	    {code_server,vsn_to_num,1},
 1015: 	    {code_server,create_bundle,2},
 1016: 	    {code_server,choose_bundles,1},
 1017: 	    {code_server,make_path,2},
 1018: 	    {code_server,get_user_lib_dirs_1,1},
 1019: 	    {code_server,get_user_lib_dirs,0},
 1020: 	    {code_server,init,3},
 1021: 	    {code_server,start_link,1}]) -> 0;
 1022: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',1},
 1023: 	   [{lists,filter,2},
 1024: 	    {code_server,try_archive_subdirs,3}|_]) -> 0;
 1025: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
 1026: 	   [{erlang,apply,2},
 1027: 	    {erlang,spawn_link,1},
 1028: 	    {code_server,start_link,1}]) -> 0;
 1029: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
 1030: 	   [{erlang,spawn_link,1},{code_server,start_link,1}]) -> 0;
 1031: check_funs({'$M_EXPR',warning_msg,2},
 1032: 	   [{code_server,finish_on_load_report,2} | _]) -> 0;
 1033: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',1},
 1034: 	   [{code_server,run,2}|_]) -> 0;
 1035: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',2},
 1036: 	   [{code_server,handle_on_load,5}|_]) -> 0;
 1037: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',2},
 1038: 	   [{code_server,handle_pending_on_load,4}|_]) -> 0;
 1039: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',2},
 1040: 	   [{code_server,finish_on_load_2,3}|_]) -> 0;
 1041: check_funs(This, Path) ->
 1042:     io:format("not_verified(~p, ~p)~n", [This, Path]),
 1043:     1.
 1044: 
 1045: my_usort(List) ->
 1046:     lists:reverse(uniq(lists:sort(List),[])).
 1047: 
 1048: uniq([],A) ->
 1049:     A;
 1050: uniq([H|T],[]) ->
 1051:     uniq(T,[H]);
 1052: uniq([H|T],[H|_]=A) ->
 1053:     uniq(T,A);
 1054: uniq([H|T],A) ->
 1055:     uniq(T,[H|A]).
 1056: 
 1057: 
 1058: where_is_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1059:     {T,KernelBeamFile} = timer:tc(code, where_is_file, ["kernel.beam"]),
 1060:     io:format("Load time: ~w ms~n", [T]),
 1061:     KernelEbinDir = filename:dirname(KernelBeamFile),
 1062:     AppFile = filename:join(KernelEbinDir, "kernel.app"),
 1063:     AppFile = code:where_is_file("kernel.app"),
 1064:     non_existing = code:where_is_file("kernel"), % no such file
 1065:     ok.
 1066: 
 1067: %% Test that stacktrace is deleted when purging a referred module.
 1068: purge_stacktrace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1069:     run_purge_test(fun purge_stacktrace_test/1, Config).
 1070:     
 1071: purge_stacktrace_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1072:     code:purge(code_b_test),
 1073:     try code_b_test:call(fun(b) -> ok end, a)
 1074:     catch
 1075: 	error:function_clause:Stacktrace ->
 1076: 	    code:load_file(code_b_test),
 1077: 	    case Stacktrace of
 1078: 		      [{?MODULE,_,[a],_},
 1079: 		       {code_b_test,call,2,_},
 1080: 		       {?MODULE,purge_stacktrace_test,1,_}|_] ->
 1081: 			  false = code:purge(code_b_test)
 1082: 		  end
 1083:     end,
 1084:     try code_b_test:call(nofun, 2)
 1085:     catch
 1086: 	error:function_clause:Stacktrace2 ->
 1087: 	    code:load_file(code_b_test),
 1088: 	    case Stacktrace2 of
 1089: 		      [{code_b_test,call,[nofun,2],_},
 1090: 		       {?MODULE,purge_stacktrace_test,1,_}|_] ->
 1091: 			  false = code:purge(code_b_test)
 1092: 		  end
 1093:     end,
 1094:     Args = [erlang,error,[badarg]],
 1095:     try code_b_test:call(erlang, error, [badarg,Args])
 1096:     catch
 1097: 	error:badarg:Stacktrace3 ->
 1098: 	    code:load_file(code_b_test),
 1099: 	    case Stacktrace3 of
 1100: 		      [{code_b_test,call,Args,_},
 1101: 		       {?MODULE,purge_stacktrace_test,1,_}|_] ->
 1102: 			  false = code:purge(code_b_test)
 1103: 		  end
 1104:     end,
 1105:     ok.
 1106: 
 1107: mult_lib_roots(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1108:     DataDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "mult_lib_roots"),
 1109:     mult_lib_compile(DataDir, "my_dummy_app-b/ebin/lists"),
 1110: 
 1111:     %% We will use this module to test both code path loading and
 1112:     %% code path caching. So we ensure its beam file does not exist.
 1113:     CodeSuiteMultRootBeam =
 1114: 	filename:join(DataDir, "first_root/my_dummy_app-c/ebin/code_SUITE_mult_root_module.beam"),
 1115:     file:delete(CodeSuiteMultRootBeam),
 1116: 
 1117:     %% Set up ERL_LIBS and start a peer node.
 1118:     ErlLibs = filename:join(DataDir, "first_root") ++ mult_lib_sep() ++
 1119: 	filename:join(DataDir, "second_root"),
 1120: 
 1121:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-env", "ERL_LIBS", ErlLibs]),
 1122: 
 1123:     Path0 = rpc:call(Node, code, get_path, []),
 1124:     %% ?CT_PEER adds extra path to this module folder
 1125:     PathToSelf = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1126:     [PathToSelf, "."|Path1] = Path0,
 1127:     [Kernel|Path2] = Path1,
 1128:     [Stdlib|Path3] = Path2,
 1129:     mult_lib_verify_lib(Kernel, "kernel"),
 1130:     mult_lib_verify_lib(Stdlib, "stdlib"),
 1131:     [Lib1,Lib2,Lib3,Lib4,Lib5|Path] = Path3,
 1132: 
 1133: 
 1134:     ["first_root/my_dummy_app-a/ebin",
 1135:      "first_root/my_dummy_app-b/ebin",
 1136:      "first_root/my_dummy_app-c/ebin",
 1137:      "second_root/my_dummy_app-d/ebin",
 1138:      "second_root/my_dummy_app-e/ebin"] =
 1139: 	[mult_lib_remove_prefix(E, DataDir) ||
 1140: 	    E <- lists:sort([Lib1,Lib2,Lib3,Lib4,Lib5])],
 1141:     io:format("~p\n", [Path]),
 1142: 
 1143:     %% Now let's attempt to dynamically add a module,
 1144:     %% this will fail due to the boot paths cache.
 1145:     error = rpc:call(Node, code, get_object_code, [code_SUITE_mult_root_module]),
 1146:     mult_lib_compile(DataDir, "my_dummy_app-c/ebin/code_SUITE_mult_root_module"),
 1147:     error = rpc:call(Node, code, get_object_code, [code_SUITE_mult_root_module]),
 1148:     %% Test that the CWD is not cached
 1149:     File = filename:join([DataDir, "first_root/my_dummy_app-c/ebin/code_SUITE_mult_root_module"]),
 1150:     {ok, _} = compile:file(File, [{outdir, "."}]),
 1151:     {_,_,_} = rpc:call(Node, code, get_object_code, [code_SUITE_mult_root_module]),
 1152:     true = rpc:call(Node, code_SUITE_mult_root_module, works_fine, []),
 1153:     file:delete("code_SUITE_mult_root_module.beam"),
 1154:     %% Clean up so we can start again
 1155:     file:delete(CodeSuiteMultRootBeam),
 1156:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1157: 
 1158:     NoCacheArgs = ["-env", "ERL_LIBS", ErlLibs, "-cache_boot_paths", "false"],
 1159:     {ok, NoCachePeer, NoCacheNode} = ?CT_PEER(NoCacheArgs),
 1160: 
 1161:     %% Now the same code should work
 1162:     error = rpc:call(NoCacheNode, code, get_object_code, [code_SUITE_mult_root_module]),
 1163:     mult_lib_compile(DataDir, "my_dummy_app-c/ebin/code_SUITE_mult_root_module"),
 1164:     {_,_,_} = rpc:call(NoCacheNode, code, get_object_code, [code_SUITE_mult_root_module]),
 1165:     true = rpc:call(NoCacheNode, code_SUITE_mult_root_module, works_fine, []),
 1166: 
 1167:     peer:stop(NoCachePeer),
 1168:     ok.
 1169: 
 1170: mult_lib_compile(Root, Last) ->
 1171:     Mod = list_to_atom(filename:basename(Last)),
 1172:     Name = filename:join([Root,"first_root",Last]),
 1173:     Dir = filename:dirname(Name),
 1174:     {ok,Mod} = compile:file(Name, [report,{outdir,Dir}]),
 1175:     ok.
 1176: 
 1177: mult_lib_sep() ->
 1178:     case os:type() of
 1179: 	{win32,_} -> ";";
 1180: 	_ -> ":"
 1181:     end.
 1182: 
 1183: mult_lib_verify_lib(Path, Expected) ->
 1184:     Dir = filename:basename(filename:dirname(Path)),
 1185:     true = lists:prefix(Expected, Dir).
 1186: 
 1187: mult_lib_remove_prefix([H|T1], [H|T2]) ->
 1188:     mult_lib_remove_prefix(T1, T2);
 1189: mult_lib_remove_prefix([$/|T], []) -> T.
 1190: 
 1191: bad_erl_libs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1192:     %% Preserve ERL_LIBS if set.
 1193:     BadLibs0 = "/no/such/dir",
 1194:     BadLibs =
 1195:          case os:getenv("ERL_LIBS") of
 1196:              false -> BadLibs0;
 1197:              Libs -> BadLibs0 ++ ":" ++ Libs
 1198:          end,
 1199:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1200:     Code = rpc:call(Node,code,get_path,[]),
 1201:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1202: 
 1203:     {ok, Peer2, Node2} = ?CT_PEER(["-env", "ERL_LIBS", BadLibs]),
 1204:     Code2 = rpc:call(Node2,code,get_path,[]),
 1205:     peer:stop(Peer2),
 1206:     %% Test that code path is not affected by the faulty ERL_LIBS
 1207:     Code = Code2,
 1208: 
 1209:     ok.
 1210: 
 1211: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1212: 
 1213: %% Create an archive file containing an application and make use of it.
 1214: 
 1215: code_archive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1216:     do_code_archive(Config, "code_archive_libs", false).
 1217: 
 1218: code_archive2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1219:     do_code_archive(Config, "code_archive_libs2", true).
 1220: 
 1221: do_code_archive(Config, Root, StripVsn) when is_list(Config) ->
 1222:     %% Copy the orig files to priv_dir
 1223:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1224:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1225:     App = code_archive_dict,
 1226:     VsnBase = atom_to_list(App) ++ "-1.0",
 1227:     Base =
 1228: 	case StripVsn of
 1229: 	    true  -> atom_to_list(App);
 1230: 	    false -> VsnBase
 1231: 	end,
 1232:     Ext = init:archive_extension(),
 1233:     RootDir = filename:join([PrivDir, Root]),
 1234:     ok = file:make_dir(RootDir),
 1235:     Archive = filename:join([RootDir, VsnBase ++ Ext]),
 1236:     {ok, _} = zip:create(Archive, [VsnBase],
 1237: 			       [{compress, []}, {cwd, DataDir}]),
 1238:     {ok, _} = zip:extract(Archive, [{cwd, PrivDir}]),
 1239: 
 1240:     case StripVsn of
 1241: 	true ->
 1242: 	    ok = file:rename(filename:join([PrivDir, VsnBase]),
 1243: 				   filename:join([PrivDir, Base]));
 1244: 	false ->
 1245: 	    ok
 1246:     end,
 1247: 
 1248:     io:format("DEBUG: ~p\n", [?LINE]),
 1249:     %% Compile the code
 1250:     ok = compile_app(PrivDir, Base),
 1251: 
 1252:     %% Create the archive
 1253:     ok = file:delete(Archive),
 1254:     {ok, _} = zip:create(Archive, [Base],
 1255: 			       [{compress, []}, {cwd, PrivDir}]),
 1256: 
 1257:     %% Create a directory and a file outside of the archive.
 1258:     OtherFile = filename:join([RootDir,VsnBase,"other","other.txt"]),
 1259:     OtherContents = ?MODULE:module_info(md5),
 1260:     filelib:ensure_dir(OtherFile),
 1261:     ok = file:write_file(OtherFile, OtherContents),
 1262: 
 1263:     %% Set up ERL_LIBS and start a peer node.
 1264:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-env", "ERL_LIBS", RootDir]),
 1265:     CodePath = rpc:call(Node, code, get_path, []),
 1266:     AppEbin = filename:join([Archive, Base, "ebin"]),
 1267:     io:format("AppEbin: ~p\n", [AppEbin]),
 1268:     io:format("CodePath: ~p\n", [CodePath]),
 1269:     io:format("Archive: ~p\n", [erl_prim_loader:read_file_info(Archive)]),
 1270:     true = lists:member(AppEbin, CodePath),
 1271: 
 1272:     %% Start the app
 1273:     ok = rpc:call(Node, application, start, [App]),
 1274: 
 1275:     %% Get the lib dir for the app.
 1276:     AppLibDir = rpc:call(Node, code, lib_dir, [App]),
 1277:     io:format("AppLibDir: ~p\n", [AppLibDir]),
 1278:     AppLibDir = filename:join(RootDir, VsnBase),
 1279: 
 1280:     %% Access the app priv dir
 1281:     AppPrivDir = rpc:call(Node, code, priv_dir, [App]),
 1282:     AppPrivFile = filename:join([AppPrivDir, "code_archive.txt"]),
 1283:     io:format("AppPrivFile: ~p\n", [AppPrivFile]),
 1284:     {ok, _Bin, _} =
 1285: 	rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, get_file, [AppPrivFile]),
 1286: 
 1287:     %% Read back the other text file.
 1288:     OtherDirPath = rpc:call(Node, code, lib_dir, [App,other]),
 1289:     OtherFilePath = filename:join(OtherDirPath, "other.txt"),
 1290:     io:format("OtherFilePath: ~p\n", [OtherFilePath]),
 1291:     {ok, OtherContents, _} =
 1292: 	rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, get_file, [OtherFilePath]),
 1293: 
 1294:     %% Use the app
 1295:     Tab = code_archive_tab,
 1296:     Key = foo,
 1297:     Val = bar,
 1298:     {ok, _Pid} =  rpc:call(Node, App, new, [Tab]),
 1299:     error =  rpc:call(Node, App, find, [Tab, Key]),
 1300:     ok =  rpc:call(Node, App, store, [Tab, Key, Val]),
 1301:     {ok, Val} =  rpc:call(Node, App, find, [Tab, Key]),
 1302:     ok =  rpc:call(Node, App, erase, [Tab, Key]),
 1303:     error =  rpc:call(Node, App, find, [Tab, Key]),
 1304:     ok =  rpc:call(Node, App, erase, [Tab]),
 1305: 
 1306:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1307:     ok.
 1308: 
 1309: compile_app(TopDir, AppName) ->
 1310:     AppDir = filename:join([TopDir, AppName]),
 1311:     SrcDir = filename:join([AppDir, "src"]),
 1312:     OutDir = filename:join([AppDir, "ebin"]),
 1313:     {ok, Files} = file:list_dir(SrcDir),
 1314:     compile_files(Files, SrcDir, OutDir).
 1315: 
 1316: compile_files([File | Files], SrcDir, OutDir) ->
 1317:     case filename:extension(File) of
 1318: 	".erl" ->
 1319: 	    AbsFile = filename:join([SrcDir, File]),
 1320: 	    case compile:file(AbsFile, [{outdir, OutDir}]) of
 1321: 		{ok, _Mod} ->
 1322: 		    compile_files(Files, SrcDir, OutDir);
 1323: 		Error ->
 1324: 		    {compilation_error, AbsFile, OutDir, Error}
 1325: 	    end;
 1326: 	_ ->
 1327: 	    compile_files(Files, SrcDir, OutDir)
 1328:     end;
 1329: compile_files([], _, _) ->
 1330:     ok.
 1331: 
 1332: %% Test that a boot file with (almost) all of OTP can be used to start an
 1333: %% embeddedd system.
 1334: big_boot_embedded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1335:     {BootArg,AppsInBoot} = create_big_boot(Config),
 1336:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-boot", BootArg, "-mode", "embedded"]),
 1337:     RemoteNodeApps =
 1338: 	[ {X,Y} || {X,_,Y} <-
 1339: 		       rpc:call(Node,application,loaded_applications,[]) ],
 1340:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1341:     true = lists:sort(AppsInBoot) =:=  lists:sort(RemoteNodeApps),
 1342:     ok.
 1343: 
 1344: on_load(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1345:     Master = on_load_test_case_process,
 1346: 
 1347:     Data = filename:join([proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),"on_load"]),
 1348:     ok = file:set_cwd(Data),
 1349:     up_to_date = make:all([{d,'MASTER',Master}]),
 1350: 
 1351:     %% Register a name for this process.
 1352:     register(Master, self()),
 1353: 
 1354:     {_,Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1355: 					  exit(on_load_a:data())
 1356: 				  end),
 1357:     receive
 1358: 	{on_load_a,start} -> ok
 1359:     end,
 1360:     receive
 1361: 	{on_load_b,start} -> ok
 1362:     end,
 1363:     receive
 1364: 	{on_load_c,PidC} -> ok
 1365:     end,
 1366: 
 1367:     Refs = on_load_massive_spawn(lists:seq(1, 50)),
 1368:     receive after 7 -> ok end,
 1369: 
 1370:     PidC ! go,
 1371: 
 1372:     KernelLibDir = code:lib_dir(kernel),
 1373:     receive
 1374: 	{on_load_c,done} -> ok
 1375:     end,
 1376:     receive
 1377: 	{on_load_b,done} -> ok
 1378:     end,
 1379:     receive
 1380: 	{on_load_a,KernelLibDir} -> ok
 1381:     end,
 1382: 
 1383:     receive
 1384: 	{'DOWN',Ref,process,_,Res} ->
 1385: 	    [a,b,c] = Res
 1386:     end,
 1387: 
 1388:     on_load_wait_for_all(Refs),
 1389:     receive
 1390: 	Any ->
 1391: 	    ct:fail({unexpected,Any})
 1392:     after 10 ->
 1393: 	    ok
 1394:     end.
 1395: 
 1396: on_load_massive_spawn([_|T]) ->
 1397:     {_,Ra} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> [a,b,c] = on_load_a:data() end),
 1398:     {_,Rb} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> [b,c] = on_load_b:data() end),
 1399:     {_,Rc} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> [c] = on_load_c:data() end),
 1400:     [Ra,Rb,Rc|on_load_massive_spawn(T)];
 1401: on_load_massive_spawn([]) -> [].
 1402: 
 1403: on_load_wait_for_all([Ref|T]) ->
 1404:     receive
 1405: 	{'DOWN',Ref,process,_,normal} ->
 1406: 	    on_load_wait_for_all(T)
 1407:     end;
 1408: on_load_wait_for_all([]) -> ok.
 1409: 
 1410: on_load_binary(_) ->
 1411:     Master = on_load_binary_test_case_process,
 1412:     register(Master, self()),
 1413: 
 1414:     %% Construct, compile and pretty-print.
 1415:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1416:     File = atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".erl",
 1417:     Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1418: 	       "-export([ok/0]).\n",
 1419: 	       "-on_load({init,0}).\n",
 1420: 	       "init() ->\n",
 1421: 	       "  '@Master@' ! {on_load_binary,self()},\n",
 1422: 	       "  receive go -> ok end.\n",
 1423: 	       "ok() -> true.\n"]),
 1424:     {ok,Mod,Bin} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1425:     merl:print(Tree),
 1426: 
 1427:     {Pid1,Ref1} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1428: 					code:load_binary(Mod, File, Bin),
 1429: 					true = on_load_binary:ok()
 1430: 				end),
 1431:     receive {Mod,OnLoadPid} -> ok end,
 1432:     {Pid2,Ref2} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1433: 					true = on_load_binary:ok()
 1434: 				end),
 1435:     erlang:yield(),
 1436:     OnLoadPid ! go,
 1437:     receive {'DOWN',Ref1,process,Pid1,Exit1} -> ok end,
 1438:     receive {'DOWN',Ref2,process,Pid2,Exit2} -> ok end,
 1439:     normal = Exit1,
 1440:     normal = Exit2,
 1441:     true = code:delete(on_load_binary),
 1442:     false = code:purge(on_load_binary),
 1443:     ok.
 1444: 
 1445: on_load_embedded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1446:     try
 1447: 	on_load_embedded_1(Config)
 1448:     catch
 1449: 	throw:{skip,_}=Skip ->
 1450: 	    Skip
 1451:     end.
 1452: 
 1453: on_load_embedded_1(Config) ->
 1454:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1455:     LinkName = proplists:get_value(link_name, Config),
 1456: 
 1457:     %% Link the on_load_app application into the lib directory.
 1458:     OnLoadApp = filename:join(DataDir, "on_load_app-1.0"),
 1459:     del_link(LinkName),
 1460:     io:format("LinkName :~p, OnLoadApp: ~p~n",[LinkName,OnLoadApp]),
 1461:     case file:make_symlink(OnLoadApp, LinkName) of
 1462: 	{error,enotsup} ->
 1463: 	    throw({skip,"Support for symlinks required"});
 1464: 	{error,eperm} ->
 1465: 	    %% On Windows, we may not have permissions to create symlinks.
 1466: 	    throw({skip,"Support for symlinks required"});
 1467: 	ok -> ok
 1468:     end,
 1469: 
 1470:     %% Compile the code.
 1471:     OnLoadAppEbin = filename:join(LinkName, "ebin"),
 1472:     {ok,_ } = compile:file(filename:join([OnLoadApp,"src",
 1473: 						"on_load_embedded"]),
 1474: 				 [{outdir,OnLoadAppEbin}]),
 1475: 
 1476:     %% Create and compile a boot file.
 1477:     true = code:add_pathz(OnLoadAppEbin),
 1478:     Options = case is_source_dir() of
 1479: 		  true -> [local];
 1480: 		  false -> []
 1481: 	      end,
 1482:     BootScript = create_boot(Config, Options),
 1483:     true = code:del_path(OnLoadAppEbin),
 1484: 
 1485:     %% Start the node and check that the on_load function was run.
 1486:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-mode", "embedded", "-boot", BootScript]),
 1487:     ok = rpc:call(Node, on_load_embedded, status, []),
 1488: 
 1489:     %% Clean up.
 1490:     peer:stop(Peer).
 1491: 
 1492: del_link(LinkName) ->
 1493:    case file:delete(LinkName) of
 1494:        {error,eperm} ->
 1495:              file:del_dir(LinkName);
 1496:        Other ->
 1497:        	     Other
 1498:    end.
 1499: 
 1500: create_boot(Config, Options) ->
 1501:     {ok, OldDir} = file:get_cwd(),
 1502:     {LatestDir,LatestName} = create_script(Config),
 1503:     ok = file:set_cwd(LatestDir),
 1504:     ok = systools:make_script(LatestName, Options),
 1505:     ok = file:set_cwd(OldDir),
 1506:     filename:join(LatestDir, LatestName).
 1507: 
 1508: create_script(Config) ->
 1509:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1510:     Name = PrivDir ++ "on_load_test",
 1511:     Apps = application_controller:which_applications(),
 1512:     {value,{_,_,KernelVer}} = lists:keysearch(kernel, 1, Apps),
 1513:     {value,{_,_,StdlibVer}} = lists:keysearch(stdlib, 1, Apps),
 1514:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(Name ++ ".rel", [write]),
 1515:     io:format(Fd,
 1516: 		    "{release, {\"Test release 3\", \"P2A\"}, \n"
 1517: 		    " {erts, \"9.42\"}, \n"
 1518: 		    " [{kernel, \"~s\"}, {stdlib, \"~s\"},"
 1519: 		    " {on_load_app, \"1.0\"}]}.\n",
 1520: 		    [KernelVer,StdlibVer]),
 1521:     file:close(Fd),
 1522:     {filename:dirname(Name),filename:basename(Name)}.
 1523: 
 1524: create_big_boot(Config) ->
 1525:     {ok, OldDir} = file:get_cwd(),
 1526:     {Options,Local} = case is_source_dir() of
 1527: 				true -> {[no_module_tests,local],true};
 1528: 				_ -> {[no_module_tests],false}
 1529: 			    end,
 1530:     {LatestDir,LatestName,Apps} = create_big_script(Config,Local),
 1531:     ok = file:set_cwd(LatestDir),
 1532:     ok = systools:make_script(LatestName, Options),
 1533:     ok = file:set_cwd(OldDir),
 1534:     {filename:join(LatestDir, LatestName),Apps}.
 1535: 
 1536: %% The following apps cannot be loaded.
 1537: 
 1538: %% Orber requires explicit configuration
 1539: filter_app("orber",_) -> false;
 1540: 
 1541: %% cos* depends on orber
 1542: filter_app("cos"++_,_) -> false;
 1543: 
 1544: %% ic has a mod instruction in the app file but no corresponding start
 1545: %% function
 1546: filter_app("ic",_) -> false;
 1547: 
 1548: %% Netconf has some dependency that I really do not understand (maybe
 1549: %% like orber)
 1550: filter_app("netconf",_) -> false;
 1551: 
 1552: %% Safe has the same kind of error in the .app file as ic
 1553: filter_app("safe",_) -> false;
 1554: 
 1555: %% Comte cannot be started in the "usual" way
 1556: filter_app("comte",_) -> false;
 1557: 
 1558: %% OS_mon does not find its port program when running cerl
 1559: filter_app("os_mon",true) -> false;
 1560: 
 1561: %% erts is not a "real" app either =/
 1562: filter_app("erts",_) -> false;
 1563: 
 1564: %% wx* depends on that wxwidgets libs
 1565: filter_app("wx"++_,_) -> false;
 1566: 
 1567: %% Other apps should be OK.
 1568: filter_app(_,_) -> true.
 1569: 
 1570: create_big_script(Config,Local) ->
 1571:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1572:     Name = filename:join(PrivDir,"full_script_test"),
 1573:     InitialApplications=application:loaded_applications(),
 1574:     %% Applications left loaded by the application suite, unload them!
 1575:     UnloadFix=[app0,app1,app2,group_leader,app_start_error],
 1576:     [application:unload(Leftover) ||
 1577: 	      Leftover <- UnloadFix,
 1578: 	      lists:keymember(Leftover,1,InitialApplications) ],
 1579:     %% Now we should have only "real" applications...
 1580:     [application:load(list_to_atom(Y))
 1581: 	|| {match,[Y]} <- [re:run(X,code:lib_dir()++"/"++"([^/-]*).*/ebin",
 1582: 		[{capture,[1],list},unicode]) ||
 1583: 	    X <- code:get_path()],filter_app(Y,Local)],
 1584:     Apps = [ {N,V} || {N,_,V} <- application:loaded_applications()],
 1585:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(Name ++ ".rel", [write]),
 1586:     io:format(Fd,
 1587: 		    "{release, {\"Test release 3\", \"P2A\"}, \n"
 1588: 		    " {erts, \"9.42\"}, \n"
 1589: 		    " ~p}.\n",
 1590: 		    [Apps]),
 1591:     file:close(Fd),
 1592:     NewlyLoaded =
 1593: 	application:loaded_applications() -- InitialApplications,
 1594:     [ application:unload(N) || {N,_,_} <- NewlyLoaded],
 1595:     {filename:dirname(Name),filename:basename(Name),Apps}.
 1596: 
 1597: is_source_dir() ->
 1598:     filename:basename(code:lib_dir(kernel)) =:= "kernel" andalso
 1599: 	filename:basename(code:lib_dir(stdlib)) =:= "stdlib".
 1600: 
 1601: on_load_errors(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1602:     Master = on_load_error_test_case_process,
 1603:     register(Master, self()),
 1604: 
 1605:     Data = filename:join([proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),"on_load_errors"]),
 1606:     ok = file:set_cwd(Data),
 1607:     up_to_date = make:all([{d,'MASTER',Master}]),
 1608: 
 1609:     do_on_load_error(an_atom),
 1610: 
 1611:     error_logger:add_report_handler(?MODULE, self()),
 1612: 
 1613:     do_on_load_error({something,terrible,is,wrong}),
 1614:     receive
 1615: 	Any1 ->
 1616: 	    {_, "The on_load function"++_,
 1617: 		   [on_load_error,
 1618: 		    {something,terrible,is,wrong},_]} = Any1
 1619:     end,
 1620: 
 1621:     do_on_load_error(fail),		%Cause exception.
 1622:     receive
 1623: 	Any2 ->
 1624: 	    {_, "The on_load function"++_,
 1625: 		   [on_load_error,{failed,[_|_]},_]} = Any2
 1626:     end,
 1627: 
 1628:     %% There should be no more messages.
 1629:     receive
 1630: 	Unexpected ->
 1631: 	    ct:fail({unexpected,Unexpected})
 1632:     after 10 ->
 1633: 	    ok
 1634:     end,
 1635: 
 1636:     %% Make sure that the code loading functions return the correct
 1637:     %% error code.
 1638:     Simple = simple_on_load_error,
 1639:     SimpleList = atom_to_list(Simple),
 1640:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_file(Simple),
 1641:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:ensure_loaded(Simple),
 1642:     {ok,SimpleCode} = file:read_file("simple_on_load_error.beam"),
 1643:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_binary(Simple, "", SimpleCode),
 1644:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_abs(SimpleList),
 1645:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_abs(SimpleList, Simple),
 1646: 
 1647:     ok.
 1648: 
 1649: do_on_load_error(ReturnValue) ->
 1650:     {_,Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1651: 					  exit(on_load_error:main())
 1652: 				  end),
 1653:     receive {on_load_error,ErrorPid} -> ok end,
 1654:     ErrorPid ! ReturnValue,
 1655:     receive
 1656: 	{'DOWN',Ref,process,_,Exit} ->
 1657: 	    {undef,[{on_load_error,main,[],_}|_]} = Exit
 1658:     end.
 1659: 
 1660: on_load_update(Config) ->
 1661:     {Mod,Code1} = on_load_update_code(1),
 1662:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code1),
 1663:     42 = Mod:a(),
 1664:     100 = Mod:b(99),
 1665:     4 = erlang:trace_pattern({Mod,'_','_'}, true),
 1666: 
 1667:     {Mod,Code2} = on_load_update_code(2),
 1668:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code2),
 1669:     42 = Mod:a(),
 1670:     78 = Mod:b(77),
 1671:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch Mod:never()),
 1672:     4 = erlang:trace_pattern({Mod,'_','_'}, false),
 1673: 
 1674:     {Mod,Code3} = on_load_update_code(3),
 1675:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code3),
 1676:     100 = Mod:c(),
 1677:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch Mod:a()),
 1678:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch Mod:b(10)),
 1679:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch Mod:never()),
 1680: 
 1681:     code:purge(Mod),
 1682:     code:delete(Mod),
 1683:     code:purge(Mod),
 1684:     ok.
 1685: 
 1686: on_load_update_code(Version) ->
 1687:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1688:     Tree = on_load_update_code_1(Version, Mod),
 1689:     io:format("Version ~p", [Version]),
 1690:     {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1691:     merl:print(Tree),
 1692:     io:nl(),
 1693:     {Mod,Code}.
 1694: 
 1695: on_load_update_code_1(1, Mod) ->
 1696:     ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1697: 	"-export([a/0,b/1]).\n"
 1698: 	"-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1699: 	"f() -> ok.\n",
 1700: 	"a() -> 42.\n"
 1701: 	"b(I) -> I+1.\n"]);
 1702: on_load_update_code_1(2, Mod) ->
 1703:     ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1704: 	"-export([never/0]).\n"
 1705: 	"-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1706: 	"f() -> 42 = '@Mod@':a(), 1 = '@Mod@':b(0), fail.\n",
 1707: 	"never() -> never.\n"]);
 1708: on_load_update_code_1(3, Mod) ->
 1709:     ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1710: 	"-export([c/0]).\n"
 1711: 	"-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1712: 	"f() -> ok.\n",
 1713: 	"c() -> 100.\n"]).
 1714: 
 1715: %% Test -on_load while trace feature 'on_load' is enabled (OTP-14612)
 1716: on_load_trace_on_load(Config) ->
 1717:     %% 'on_load' enables tracing for all newly loaded modules, so we make a dry
 1718:     %% run to ensure that ancillary modules like 'merl' won't be loaded during
 1719:     %% the actual test.
 1720:     on_load_update(Config),
 1721: 
 1722:     Papa = self(),
 1723:     Tracer = spawn_link(fun F() -> receive M -> Papa ! M end, F() end),
 1724:     {tracer,[]} = erlang:trace_info(self(),tracer),
 1725:     erlang:trace(self(), true, [call, {tracer, Tracer}]),
 1726:     erlang:trace_pattern(on_load, true, []),
 1727:     on_load_update(Config),
 1728:     erlang:trace_pattern(on_load, false, []),
 1729:     erlang:trace(self(), false, [call]),
 1730: 
 1731:     Ms = flush(),
 1732:     [{trace, Papa, call, {on_load_update_code, a, []}},
 1733:      {trace, Papa, call, {on_load_update_code, b, [99]}},
 1734:      {trace, Papa, call, {on_load_update_code, c, []}}] = Ms,
 1735: 
 1736:     exit(Tracer, normal),
 1737:     ok.
 1738: 
 1739: flush() ->
 1740:     receive M -> [M | flush()]
 1741:     after 100 -> []
 1742:     end.
 1743: 
 1744: on_load_purge(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1745:     run_purge_test(fun on_load_purge_test/1, Config).
 1746: 
 1747: on_load_purge_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1748:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1749:     register(Mod, self()),
 1750:     Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1751: 	       "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1752: 	       "loop() -> loop().\n",
 1753: 	       "f() ->\n",
 1754: 	       "'@Mod@' ! {self(),spawn(fun loop/0)},\n",
 1755: 	       "receive Ack -> Ack end.\n"]),
 1756:     merl:print(Tree),
 1757:     {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1758:     P = spawn(fun() ->
 1759: 		      exit(code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code))
 1760: 	      end),
 1761:     monitor(process, P),
 1762:     receive
 1763: 	{Pid1,Pid2} ->
 1764: 	    monitor(process, Pid2),
 1765: 	    Pid1 ! ack_and_failure,
 1766: 	    receive
 1767: 		{'DOWN',_,process,P,Exit1} ->
 1768: 		    {error,on_load_failure} = Exit1
 1769: 	    end,
 1770: 	    receive
 1771: 		{'DOWN',_,process,Pid2,Exit2} ->
 1772: 		    io:format("~p\n", [Exit2])
 1773: 	    after 10000 ->
 1774: 		    ct:fail(no_down_message)
 1775: 	    end
 1776:     end,
 1777:     unregister(Mod),
 1778:     ok.
 1779: 
 1780: on_load_self_call(_Config) ->
 1781:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1782:     register(Mod, self()),
 1783:     Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1784: 	       "-export([ext/0]).\n",
 1785: 	       "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1786: 	       "f() ->\n",
 1787: 	       "  '@Mod@' ! (catch '@Mod@':ext()),\n",
 1788: 	       "  ok.\n",
 1789: 	       "ext() -> good_work.\n"]),
 1790:         merl:print(Tree),
 1791:     {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1792: 
 1793:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = on_load_do_load(Mod, Code),
 1794:     good_work = on_load_do_load(Mod, Code),
 1795: 
 1796:     ok.
 1797: 
 1798: on_load_do_load(Mod, Code) ->
 1799:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 1800:                        {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code)
 1801:                end),
 1802:     receive
 1803: 	Any -> Any
 1804:     end.
 1805: 
 1806: on_load_pending(_Config) ->
 1807:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1808:     Tree1 = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1809: 		"-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1810: 		"f() ->\n",
 1811: 		"  register('@Mod@', self()),\n",
 1812: 		"  receive _ -> ok end.\n"]),
 1813:     merl:print(Tree1),
 1814:     {ok,Mod,Code1} = merl:compile(Tree1),
 1815: 
 1816:     Tree2 = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1817: 		"-export([t/0]).\n",
 1818: 		"t() -> ok.\n"]),
 1819:     merl:print(Tree2),
 1820:     {ok,Mod,Code2} = merl:compile(Tree2),
 1821: 
 1822:     Self = self(),
 1823:     {_,Ref1} =
 1824: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1825: 			      Self ! started1,
 1826: 			      {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code1)
 1827: 		      end),
 1828:     receive started1 -> ok end,
 1829:     timer:sleep(10),
 1830:     {_,Ref2} =
 1831: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1832: 			      Self ! started2,
 1833: 			      {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code2),
 1834: 			      ok = Mod:t()
 1835: 		      end),
 1836:     receive started2 -> ok end,
 1837:     receive
 1838: 	Unexpected ->
 1839: 	    ct:fail({unexpected,Unexpected})
 1840:     after 100 ->
 1841: 	    ok
 1842:     end,
 1843:     Mod ! go,
 1844:     receive
 1845: 	{'DOWN',Ref1,process,_,normal} -> ok
 1846:     end,
 1847:     receive
 1848: 	{'DOWN',Ref2,process,_,normal} -> ok
 1849:     end,
 1850:     ok = Mod:t(),
 1851:     ok.
 1852: 
 1853: on_load_deleted(_Config) ->
 1854:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1855: 
 1856:     R0 = fun() ->
 1857: 		 Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1858: 			    "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1859: 			    "f() -> ok.\n"]),
 1860: 		 merl:print(Tree),
 1861: 		 {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1862: 		 {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code)
 1863: 	 end,
 1864:     delete_before_reload(Mod, R0),
 1865:     delete_before_reload(Mod, R0),
 1866: 
 1867:     R1 = fun() ->
 1868: 		 Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1869: 			    "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1870: 			    "f() -> fail.\n"]),
 1871: 		 merl:print(Tree),
 1872: 		 {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1873: 		 {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code)
 1874: 	 end,
 1875:     delete_before_reload(Mod, R1),
 1876:     delete_before_reload(Mod, R1),
 1877: 
 1878:     OtherMod = list_to_atom(lists:concat([Mod,"_42"])),
 1879:     OtherTree = ?Q(["-module('@OtherMod@').\n"]),
 1880:     merl:print(OtherTree),
 1881:     {ok,OtherMod,OtherCode} = merl:compile(OtherTree),
 1882: 
 1883:     R2 = fun() ->
 1884: 		 RegName = 'on_load__registered_name',
 1885: 		 Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1886: 			    "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1887: 			    "f() ->\n",
 1888: 			    "  register('@RegName@', self()),\n",
 1889: 			    "  receive _ -> ok end.\n"]),
 1890: 		 merl:print(Tree),
 1891: 		 {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1892: 		 spawn_link(fun() ->
 1893:                                     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code)
 1894:                             end),
 1895: 		 receive after 1 -> ok end,
 1896: 		 {module,OtherMod} = code:load_binary(OtherMod, "",
 1897: 						      OtherCode),
 1898: 		 RegName ! stop
 1899: 	 end,
 1900:     delete_before_reload(Mod, R2),
 1901: 
 1902:     ok.
 1903: 
 1904: delete_before_reload(Mod, Reload) ->
 1905:     false = check_old_code(Mod),
 1906: 
 1907:     Tree1 = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1908: 		"-export([f/1]).\n",
 1909: 		"f(Parent) ->\n",
 1910: 		"  register('@Mod@', self()),\n",
 1911: 		"  Parent ! started,\n",
 1912: 		"  receive _ -> ok end.\n"]),
 1913:     merl:print(Tree1),
 1914:     {ok,Mod,Code1} = merl:compile(Tree1),
 1915: 
 1916:     Self = self(),
 1917:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 1918:                        {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code1),
 1919:                        Mod:f(Self)
 1920:                end),
 1921:     receive started -> ok end,
 1922: 
 1923:     true = code:delete(Mod),
 1924:     true = check_old_code(Mod),
 1925: 
 1926:     Reload(),
 1927: 
 1928:     %% When loading the the module with the -on_load() function,
 1929:     %% the reference to the old code would be lost. Make sure that
 1930:     %% the old code is remembered and is still preventing the
 1931:     %% purge.
 1932:     false = code:soft_purge(Mod),
 1933: 
 1934:     %% Get rid of the old code.
 1935:     Mod ! stop,
 1936:     receive after 1 -> ok end,
 1937:     true = code:soft_purge(Mod),
 1938: 
 1939:     %% Unload the version of the module with the -on_load() function.
 1940:     true = code:delete(Mod),
 1941:     true = code:soft_purge(Mod),
 1942: 
 1943:     ok.
 1944: 
 1945: %% Test that the mode of the code server is properly retrieved.
 1946: get_mode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1947:     interactive = code:get_mode().
 1948: 
 1949: %% Make sure that the paths for all loaded modules have been normalized.
 1950: normalized_paths(_Config) ->
 1951:     do_normalized_paths(erlang:loaded()).
 1952: 
 1953: do_normalized_paths([M|Ms]) ->
 1954:     case code:which(M) of
 1955: 	Special when is_atom(Special) ->
 1956: 	    do_normalized_paths(Ms);
 1957: 	File when is_list(File) ->
 1958: 	    File = filename:join([File]),
 1959: 	    do_normalized_paths(Ms)
 1960:     end;
 1961: do_normalized_paths([]) ->
 1962:     ok.
 1963: 
 1964: %% Make sure that the extra -mode flags are ignored
 1965: mult_embedded_flags(_Config) ->
 1966:     Modes = [{["-mode", "embedded"], embedded},
 1967: 	     {["-mode", "interactive"], interactive},
 1968: 	     {["-mode", "invalid"], interactive}],
 1969: 
 1970:     [ begin
 1971: 	  {ArgMode, ExpectedMode} = Mode,
 1972: 	  {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(ArgMode),
 1973: 	  ExpectedMode = rpc:call(Node, code, get_mode, []),
 1974: 	  peer:stop(Peer)
 1975:       end || Mode <- Modes],
 1976: 
 1977:     [ begin
 1978: 	  {ArgIgnoredMode, _} = IgnoredMode,
 1979: 	  {ArgRelevantMode, ExpectedMode} = RelevantMode,
 1980: 	  {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(ArgRelevantMode ++ ArgIgnoredMode),
 1981: 	  ExpectedMode = rpc:call(Node, code, get_mode, []),
 1982: 	  peer:stop(Peer)
 1983:       end || IgnoredMode <- Modes, RelevantMode <- Modes],
 1984:     ok.
 1985: 
 1986: %% Test that module_status/1 behaves as expected
 1987: module_status(_Config) ->
 1988:     case test_server:is_cover() of
 1989:         true ->
 1990:             module_status();
 1991:         false ->
 1992:             %% Make sure that we terminate the cover server.
 1993:             try
 1994:                 module_status()
 1995:             after
 1996:                 cover:stop()
 1997:             end
 1998:     end.
 1999: 
 2000: module_status() ->
 2001:     %% basics
 2002:     not_loaded = code:module_status(fubar),     % nonexisting
 2003:     {file, preloaded} = code:is_loaded(erlang),
 2004:     loaded = code:module_status(erlang),        % preloaded
 2005:     loaded = code:module_status(?MODULE),       % normal known loaded
 2006: 
 2007:     %% module_status/0 returns status for each loaded module
 2008:     true = (lists:sort([{M, code:module_status(M)}
 2009:                         || {M, _} <- code:all_loaded()])
 2010:             =:= lists:sort(code:module_status())),
 2011: 
 2012:     non_existing = code:which(?TESTMOD), % verify dummy name not in path
 2013:     code:purge(?TESTMOD), % ensure no previous version in memory
 2014:     code:delete(?TESTMOD),
 2015:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
 2016: 
 2017:     %% generated code is detected as such
 2018:     {ok,?TESTMOD,Bin} = compile:forms(dummy_ast(), []),
 2019:     {module,?TESTMOD} = code:load_binary(?TESTMOD,"",Bin),  % no source file
 2020:     ok = ?TESTMOD:f(),
 2021:     "" = code:which(?TESTMOD), % verify empty string for source file
 2022:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2023: 
 2024:     %% module_status/1 also accepts a list of modules
 2025:     [] = code:module_status([]),
 2026:     [{erlang, loaded},{?MODULE,loaded},{?TESTMOD,loaded}] =
 2027:         code:module_status([erlang, ?MODULE, ?TESTMOD]),
 2028: 
 2029:     %% deleting generated code
 2030:     true = code:delete(?TESTMOD),
 2031:     non_existing = code:which(?TESTMOD), % verify still not in path
 2032:     not_loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2033: 
 2034:     %% beam file exists but not loaded
 2035:     make_source_file(<<"0">>),
 2036:     compile_beam(0),
 2037:     true = (non_existing =/= code:which(?TESTMOD)), % verify in path
 2038:     not_loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2039: 
 2040:     %% loading code from disk makes it loaded
 2041:     load_code(),
 2042:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % loaded
 2043: 
 2044:     %% cover compiling a module
 2045:     {ok,?TESTMOD} = cover:compile(?TESTMOD),
 2046:     {file, cover_compiled} = code:is_loaded(?TESTMOD), % verify cover compiled
 2047:     modified = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % loaded cover code but file exists
 2048:     remove_code(),
 2049:     removed = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % removed
 2050:     compile_beam(0),
 2051:     modified = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % recreated
 2052:     load_code(),
 2053:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % loading removes cover status
